p.s: The following analysis will analyse the author's intention by focusing on the use of stylistic devices.
The author writes about a current global issue and wants to inform about the effects and causes of globalised environmental pollution.
She also wants to make, us, the readers aware about this issue.
The author uses academical language in a serious tone.
There are many facts by scientists that are listed in the article/blog to underline her arguments, like The biosphere has [...] oxygen, nitrogen, carbon dioxide, argon and water vapor (ll. 6-7).
She also asks a question (l. 18-19) to make the reader think about the worth of our actions.
Furthermore, the author takes away the big effects (l. 21-24) and also emphasizes that there are more causes to make the reader aware of being able to do sthsomething against the pollution.
Therefore, she quotes scientists we are living in an era of mass extinction, due to human made environmental pollution to underline the effects and also the causes.
There is also an example the author uses to underline the effects pointing out that many people died because of pollution (l. 31-32).
Moreover, she uses stylistic devices like a comparison with Hiroshima to make us aware about a possible end of our world to shock the reader.
The author also uses many stilisticstylistic devices to reach the reader.
By employing pronouns as we and our she underlines that everyone should be concerned including herself.
Therefore she uses many connotativesconnotative words so that the reader looks from a negative perspective.
All in all the author intends to make us aware and wants us to take action against this issue.
